subject: Art & Design
title: Fashion as Political Protest
description: A fast breakdown of Fashion as Political Protest for builders.

hook.text: Suffragettes wore white to symbolize purity. Black Panthers wore leather and berets. Clothing is always political.

buildup.text: Throughout history, clothing has communicated resistance: Gandhi's khadi, Mandela's Madiba shirt.

discovery.text: What you wear can signal solidarity, defiance, or identity. Fashion is a visible, daily form of political speech.

twist.text: Brands co-opt political fashion for profit.

climax.text: Melania Trump's 'I Don't Really Care, Do U?' jacket proved fashion statements cut both ways.

punchline.text: You can't opt out of fashion politics. Even 'no statement' is a statement.

quiz.question: Why did Gandhi wear hand-spun khadi cloth?
options: As political resistance against British textile imports and colonialism
Because it was the most fashionable fabric in India
Khadi was the only fabric available during the drought
